Caption: Figure 1: Fisher’s linear discriminant separating two groups.

Figure 2: The Subspace Explorer showing a highly Clumpy 20-D random projection for a dataset with 2000 rows, 500 dimensions and clusters embedded in 5 dimensions. The detected known embedding dimensions are shown as orange text. (A) Control options. (B) Biplot View of the data subspace. (C) Random Projection View of the biplot of the projected data space. (D) ScoreView of the top 10 scoring random projections. The selected (red) bar represents one 20-D random projection which is shown in different perspectives in the other plots. (E) Radar plot Icon summary of all scores for the selected random projection. (F) Variable List (same set as B). (G) Parallel Coordinate View of the top used dimensions (same set as B)

Figure 3: The interchangeable Data Views with the detected known embedding dimensions shown as orange text. (A) Radial View of links between all the top used dimensions in the selected 20-D random projection. (B) SPLOM View of the top 5 used dimensions. (C) Biplot View of all the top used dimensions.

Figure 4: Table summarizing validation test results on synthetic data for each score function. The graphs on the right show canonical ex- amples of the structures in 2-D that the score functions detect. Simi- lar structures will be embedded in noisy higher-dimensional spaces.
Figure 6: The Sparse score is maximized and correctly discovers three of the variables from the embedding space, shown in orange text.
Figure 5: The Outlying score is maximized for multivariate Cauchy data and detected outliers are shown in white.
Figure 7: The Striated score is maximized showing a clearly striated view in this data set with n = 5000, p = 50, m = 5 where the embedding space is 10% of the ambient space..
Figure 11: The GoMoos weather dataset has 160 dimensions from 10 different sensors. We maximize the Stringy score and select a scatterplot in the SPLOM showing two positively-correlated dimen- sions.

Figure 8: The Stringy score is maximized to show a clearly stringy view in the random projection space. Hovering over a random pro- jection vector highlights the variables it turns on in magenta text.

Figure 8: The Stringy score is maximized to show a clearly stringy view in the random projection space. Hovering over a random pro- jection vector highlights the variables it turns on in magenta text.

Figure 10: Hovering over a variable (highlighted in magenta) in the Radial View selects (in cyan) those it co-occurs with across the q- D random projections. Selecting it updates the Data Space Views with the data filtered on the variables co-occurring with the selected variable.
Figure 12: The GoMoos weather dataset with the Data Views show- ing the subspace described by the selected 1-D random projection RP8 (highlighted in magenta).
Figure 13: Computation times (in seconds) for large datasets where n is the number of observations and p is the number of dimensions.
